Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: PRO Tip: Since KMD core will soon learn -ac_NK params and every new asset chain will be able to choose it's N,K values, it's smart for mining pool operators to plan on supporting any combination of N,K

Content:
`i won't say, it is/was easy, but result is viewable on zpool anyways. sapling (one row into coinbasetx header more and tons of zeros at the end of coinbasetx) was done in collaboration with phm.`
@Ondalf I'm not sure how/why you dragged yourself into an elongated months-long conversation, but....
While I always welcome valuable input, pointing to the pool that's the cause of the topic as an example isn't that. This entire feken conversation started because zpool had the equihash bits and crackerz wanted to pay someone to write KMD into his pool but he refused to share the equihash bits.
In other words, he wanted someone to start with less than he already and redo everything he already had, blind.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @phm87 i think adding -ac_pers seems like a good option, it just makes sense for KMD to support that and my guess is that James would merge it

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: there are at least 7 "pers strings" in use already: https://forum.bitcoingold.org/t/list-of-equihash-coins-by-implementation-parameters/1929

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the combination of -ac_NK, -ac_blocktime and -ac_pers means you could exactly replicate other coins purely with KMD CLI arguments

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: what if I want my new coin to not be compatible with all existing ASICs?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: at some point, the uniqueness of being something special for doing what no one else does is going to give way to the uniqueness of doing what *everyone* else does

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: KMD could easily provide that, via -ac_pers

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I am not saying it's a good idea

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I am saying, let the blockchain devs creating the chain make that decision. We are making the tools in the toolbox

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: We have all nk params supported now, it would be trivial to height activate the number to change I think. Just keep rotating around... Basically means daemon solo mining is the only thing that works

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: (height % N) selects the N/K from a list

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: jl777 and FSM has merged the -ac for N/K params 150,5 is supported. I guess any combination is supported? even ones that are nonsensical

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: nonsensical N,K support?!?!? I must be dreaming

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢 changing the pers string is a trivial way to change the output of all hashes without any real algo changes, so if you wanted, you could make a new 200,9 coin for which no currently available  ASICs would work for.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: my understanding is that only a small subset of N/K values are valid

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: yes, and furthermore

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a list of all the valid ones would be very good to have

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: only a very few combinations have the ratio between N/K optimize the ratio between GPU and ASIC mining efficiency

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so some are GPU centric and others ASIC?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but if there is no ASIC...

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @blackjok3r this super old code might interest you, which can change N,K values based on NU heights: https://github.com/zcash/zcash/issues/1211#issuecomment-379882647

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Page 3 of this: https://docs.beam.mw/Beam_Equihash.pdf

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: 150,5 has the best currently known ratio between ASIC and GPU

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: no real analysis of FPGA

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so what percentage of all the possible N,K values (using reasonable caps) are valid combinations, assumed you dont care about ASIC vs GPU

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: https://forum.bitcoingold.org/t/list-of-equihash-coins-by-implementation-parameters/1929 lists almost all of them, might be a few new ones pop'ed up

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: only 5 combinations of N,K are in active use, it seems

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c very small %

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: before 150,5, it was never true that N % 8 != 0

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: people didn't want to look at it

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: because unrolling 8 loops at a time, there was deep code about that

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: but beam I think decided to research N%8!=0 and found 150,5

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: ZEC never looked in that corner

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c some combination are straight up invalid, I believe. K > N should give an error, for instance

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: can't remember if N = K is technically valid or just dumb

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think our NK support is based on beam, so maybe it isnt limited to n%8 == 0

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: would be nice to have something that lets people experiment with all the possible combinations

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: yes, I think allowing any "valid" combination of N,K, regardless of whether we think it's a good idea, makes our tool that more general

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Perhaps somebody wants to study all possible N,K values. The very best way to do that would be with KMD tools

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c and yes, blackjoker ported beam code to support 150,5, i am not sure how "general" it is, I think it can support any N%5=0, but it doesn't support N%17=0 for instance

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: maybe it supports any N! that would be cool

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think efficiency doesnt matter much for the reference miner. just getting it to support all possible values alone is very cool

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: agreed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @blackjok3r i think you ported the beam miner, did you see how hard it would be to support any N value?
